RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500T o $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000. Three year olds claiming $6,000 BC Bred Three year olds $7,500).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SELF SERVING settled well off the pacesetter while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, launched his bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed willingly from just off the rail in the drive to get up in time. EARS TO US away alertly and rushed to a clear lead while racing out from the rail entering the first turn, increased his advantage in the run down the backstretch, maintained a big lead through the final turn while drifting out leaving the turn, and continued to drift to the middle of the track in the lane, and just failed to last. EH TEE EM unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and improved his position in the lane while finishing at the rail. THREE DAY BENDER stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, struggled to keep in contact with the pacesetter in the run to the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong. CHAMPIOSA broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but faded in the late stages. Upon returning to be unsaddled, it was reported that CHAMPIOSA bled. The three quarter split for this race was HAND TIMED.

ENTRY.NAME: Self Serving
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Champiosa
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled inside, rallied 2 wide, faded, bled

ENTRY.NAME: Ears to Us
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, clear lead, drifted out, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Three Day Bender
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Eh Tee Em
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed rail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 30 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 30 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KAY'S KITCHEN broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace through the second turn and in the run down the backside, maintained her advantage through the final turn, drifted five wide in the lane, but held ZETAMARIE safely at bay to prove best. ZETAMARIE away alertly and tracked the pacesetter two wide entering the stretch the first time, maintained a stalking trip in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was never a serious threat late but finished determinedly two wide in the drive in a solid effort. IRISH LUNA tracked the leader into the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, dropped back to trail in the run down the backstretch while taken in hand, and was pulled up leaving the final turn. IRISH LUNA walked off after the race under her own power.

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Luna
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, trailed, pulled up, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Kay's Kitchen
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, closed 5 wide, held

ENTRY.NAME: Zetamarie
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson, Gary C., Pumpkin Stable and Sharlea Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 30 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 30 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $ 8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000. Three year olds $12,000, (Three year old BC Bred $15,000).(Races where entered for $6250 or less not considered in Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TEXAS HUMOR away well and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing two wide into the backstretch, began to advance three wide midway down the backside to gain a tracking trip approaching the final turn, rallied three wide through the turn, and closed willingly three wide in the drive to get up in the final strides to prevail. NINE OCLOCK CEASER tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide in the run to the final turn, took command entering the final turn, and just failed to last. TAM TRICKY broke sharply, but bobbled in the opening strides before racing into a stalking trip from along the inside entering the backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn and finished with late interest three wide in the drive to garner a share. TIZ THE PROSPECT away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of NINE OCLOCK CEASER in he run to the final turn, was unable to match strides with her pace rival entering the turn and steadied slightly when put in tight quarters by that rival, and was outfinished over the final furlong. PEACEHAVEN unhurried early and trailed the field into the backstretch, was always well back and failed to make an impact. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's objection. The rider of TIZ THE PROSPECT lodged a claim of foul against the rider of NINE OCLOCK CEASER, for alleged interference entering the final turn. After review the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Peacehaven
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Nine Oclock Ceaser
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, pressed 2 wide, led, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Tam Tricky
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked inside, rallied 2w, rallied 2w, closed 3 w

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz the Prospect
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, steadied 1/4, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Humor
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 2 w, advanced 3/8, rallied 3w, up in time

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 44. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KIKI'S SUNDANCER away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace while opening a clear lead in the run down the backside and widened his advantage over the final furlong while under confident handling. DAPPER DON was squeezed at the start and dropped back to trail entering the first turn, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive to get up for the place. TEXAS MOONSHINE stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide through the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive to get up for a share. BE SPARKY away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but was outfinished in the late stages. SHOWMAN broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing three out from the rail, struggled to keep tabs on the pacesetter entering the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong. MEMORANDUM stalked the leader from along the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid from along the inside entering the final turn, went awry midway through the turn while unseating his rider, and was vanned off following the race.

ENTRY.NAME: Memorandum
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, broke down, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Be Sparky
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2w, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Showman
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 4 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Dapper Don
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Kiki's Sundancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, clear lead, widened

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Moonshine
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 30 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 30 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4, 000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ISLAND LIVING broke sharply and tracked the leader from along the rail entering the backstretch, rallied from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed determinedly four wide in deep stretch to get up in the closing strides to prevail. PENALTY TO RANGERS away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, maintained her advantage into the final turn, and just failed to last. PERFECT PENNY stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide from between rivals entering the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive to garner a share, the rider of PERFECT PENNY lost his whip on the final turn. STAR FINALITY away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, battled two wide into the final turn, and finished from along the inside in the stretch drive. GWEN stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied along the inside from the back of the pack entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive. THESKYISTHELIMIT tracked the pacesetters while racing three wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Island Living
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, track rail, rallied inside, closed 4 w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Star Finality
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Theskyisthelimit
ENTRY.OWNER: Dreamtime Stable Clark Heather and Beneen Greg
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Penalty to Rangers
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed 2w, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Gwen
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide, lost whip

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 21000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pri ce $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STAY FANTASTIC away well and was allowed to settle off the contested early pace while saving ground along the inside rallied smartly two wide entering the final turn, overtook the pacesetter midway through the turn, and was all out to hold off WISELY PLAYED late to prevail. WISELY PLAYED settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, launched his bid two wide entering he final turn, and found his best stride late while closing four wide in the drive to just miss. STORMY BLUE away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of JOSE JOSE through the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was overtaken midway through the turn, and faded late in a game effort. PRINCE CAIRO was unprepared and hopped at the start to get away poorly, trailed the field through the second turn and in the run down the backside, saved ground while commencing his bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and improved his position late while finishing four wide in the drive. JOSE JOSE broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from the inside of STORMY BLUE in the run down the backstretch, struggled to match strides with that rival entering the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong. CAB SAV tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing just out from the rail, maintained his position in the run down the backstretch, but began to weaken entering the final turn while racing two out from the rail, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Cab Sav
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Jose Jose
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Stay Fantastic
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled inside, rallied 2 wide, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Wisely Played
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Sutherland June Stajkowski Neil Hickman Barry and Small Lesley
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Prince Cairo
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepared, hopped start, trailed, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Stormy Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, late fade

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pri ce $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000. Three year olds $12,000, (Three year old BC Bred $15,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ERLICH away well and stalked the early pace while racing two wide through the stretch the first time, maintained his position in the run down the backstretch rallied one out from the rail entering the final turn, and closed determinedly three wide in the drive to get up in time. LOGICAL AL tracked the leader one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, continued to track the pacesetter in the run down the backstretch, collared the leader while mounting a two wide rally entering the final turn, assumed control midway through the final turn and just failed to last. BETTER TONE settled off the early pace while racing three out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, began to advance three wide soon after entering he backside, rallied three wide through the final turn, and finished for wide in the drive to garner a share. JERSEYS IMAGE stalked the early pace while racing three out from the rail through the stretch the first time, advanced five wide midway down the backside, rallied four wide entering the final turn and improved his position over the final furlong while finishing four wide in the drive. CRYPTO MUNNY away alertly and stalked the pacesetter from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, maintained a tracking trip in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but needed more when called upon. JOCK TALK unhurried early while trailing the field into the stretch the first time, bided his time at the back of the pack in the run down the backside, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. ASKMENOQUESTIONS broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace through the second turn and in the run down the backside, battled from the inside of LOGICAL AL for the lead entering he final turn, but faded in the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: Crypto Munny
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Logical Al
ENTRY.OWNER: Canoe Pass Stables and MacPherson Craig
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Jock Talk
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Erlich
ENTRY.OWNER: Christoff, Gordon and Giesbrecht, Lance B.
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2w, rallied 2w, closed 3w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Jerseys Image
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 5w, advanced 3/8, rallied 4w, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Better Tone
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 4 wide, advanced 1/2, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Askmenoquestions
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, faded
